title: Integration Studio—OpenAI ChatGPT integration
content:
SMAX now offers a native integration with OpenAI ChatGPT.

Important:

As we are in the early stages of these tools, there are several reasons to be cautious, given concerns around security, IP ownership, and the potential sharing of confidential company information. Please be mindful that generative AI companies have not published or determined the use of your data.

You must maintain confidentiality by not sharing proprietary or confidential company information with search or AI tools. There are no clear indications of how entered data will be used, who will have access to it, or if it would be shared with any third parties.

In terms of privacy, employees must comply with all data privacy laws and regulations when using AI tools. Never share personal data with AI engines, such as employee names, social security numbers, addresses, and so on. Furthermore, the source of the IP in these tools is unclear.

OpenText cannot be made responsible for any consequences resulting from using this integration.

The integration use cases described in this document serve as examples to inspire and guide your integration efforts. However, they should not be considered as prescriptive or guaranteed solutions for your particular scenario. The examples may or may not be applicable for your license edition.


Use Case–Agent support by ChatGPT

An agent receives a request from an end user about a technical question. The agent cannot find any information in the internal knowledge base and is using the ChatGPT integration to resolve the request without escalating to the 2nd-level support.

To ask a question to ChatGPT, the agent enters the question as a comment of purpose “Ask ChatGPT”. The system then sends the question to ChatGPT and stores the response in the Discussions tab within the ticket. The support agent can now review the response and if applicable, resolve the ticket.

Set up the integration

Prerequisites

Before you begin, complete the following prerequisites:

  • Create an account on the OpenAI platform.
  • Create an API Key.

Prepare integration user

Perform the following steps to prepare an integration user:

  1. Create an integration user. See How to create an integration user.

  2. Log in to the Agent Portal of SMAX as the tenant admin, navigate to Administration > Master Data > People, locate the integration user, and then assign the proper role to grant access to the required modules. Example: Service Request Agent.

    Alternatively, add the Tenant Admin role to grant general access.

Add ChatGPT to the "Comment purpose" enum list

To allow the agent to choose the ChatGPT option from the Purpose drop-down list when creating comments, you need to add the ChatGPT item to the “Comment purpose” list.

Navigate to Administration > Configuration > Lists, search for “Comment purpose”, and then add a new item with the following details.

ParameterValue
NameChatGPT
Display NameAsk ChatGPT
Insert AfterStatusUpdate

Create the question field in the record type

To prevent common ticket data from being sent to ChatGPT, you can create a dedicated field in the Request record type to store the question sent to ChatGPT, so that you can keep a history of all questions sent to ChatGPT.

Navigate to Administration > Configuration > Studio, select the Request record type from the drop-down list, and then select the Fields tab.

Next, add a new field with the following details.

ParameterValue
NameGPTQuestion_c
Multilingual labelGPTQuestion
Logical typeRICH_TEXT
Hiddentrue

Create an endpoint

To configure the integration, firstly create an endpoint by using the Rest Executor 2.0 endpoint type.

  1. Log in to the Agent Portal as the tenant admin.
  2. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints.
  3. Click Add.
  4. Select Rest Executor 2.0 as the endpoint type, enter a name for the endpoint (for example, OpenAI), and then click Add. The system creates the endpoint.
  5. Click Configure and complete the following fields.
FieldValue
AgentSelect Agentless for a direct connection to ChatGPT.
Authentication typeSelect Bearer Token.
Protocol    Select https.
Base URLEnter the base URL of the ChatGPT system: https://api.openai.com/
TokenEnter the API key from OpenAI, which was generated earlier. See the prerequisite section.
Certificate typeOptional
Certificate formatOptional
Server certificateOptional

Create an Integration

Create an integration and configure a scenario to define the business logic for sending questions to ChatGPT and storing the response in the ticket. The OpenAI integration has one predefined scenario template: ChatGPT Agent Support, which supports the use case described at the beginning of this page.

In the following steps, you'll create an integration with the predefined template.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio.
  2. Click New, enter the name of your integration, and then click Save. The system displays the Integration page.
  3. In the Details section, configure the integration user you created for the current Service Management system and activate the integration.
  4. In the Connector-Endpoint mappings section, click Add to add a mapping.
  5. Select REST API (under OpenAI) as the connector, select the OpenAI endpoint that you created earlier, and then enter an alias for the mapping.
  6. Click Save.

Configure the scenario

Perform the following steps to add the scenario to the integration:

  1. Click Add scenario.
  2. Enter a name for the scenario. For example, enter ChatGPT Agent Support.
  3. In the Template field, select ChatGPT Agent Support (under OpenAI REST API) from the list.
  4. Click Save to add the scenario.
Note: Using templates will make the integration configuration easier than starting from scratch. If you don't select this option, you'll have to manually add your own logic, starting from a blank page.

When using the template, you must configure the following parameters in the Settings rule at the start of the process logic section:

  • PropertyName_Question—The name of the property where the question is stored. In this document, we use “GPTQuestion_c” as the question field.
  • Disclaimer—Enter your company-specific disclaimer when integrating with ChatGPT.
  • UserIdIntegrationUser—The Id of the integration user created earlier, which is used as the user to add comments to the SMAX request record.

Understand the scenario

The following describes the logic of the scenario rules so that you can customize the scenario as needed.

  1. Sets the parameters as described in the previous section.
  2. Gets the question from the Question field of the SMAX request record.
  3. Sends the question to ChatGPT, using the specified models.
  4. Adds the disclaimer message to the request record as a comment.
  5. Adds the answer from ChatGPT to the request record as a comment.

Configure business rules to trigger the scenario

Now, you need to create two business rules in the Service Management Studio to trigger the integration from a Support Request.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Configuration > Studio

  2. Select the Request record type from the drop-down list, and then select the Processes and Rules tab.

Add a rule to extract the question from the comment

To extract the comment of type ChatGPT and then save it in the question field, select the Support workflow and add a new “Set Field” rule with the following details under the “After change” section.

  • Enter the following in the rule's If condition expression field to filter the last comment with the purpose ChatGPT_c:

    ${contain(extract_property (filter_comments (current_update.Comments.NewValue), 'FunctionalPurpose'), 'ChatGPT_c')}

  • Select GPTQuestion as the field.

  • Enter the following in the value field to save the comment to the GPTQuestion field.

    ${extract_property (filter_comments (current_update.Comments.NewValue), 'CommentBody')}

Add a rule to trigger the Integration Studio scenario

To trigger the integration scenario created earlier, select the Support workflow and add a new "Call Integration Studio" rule with the following details under the “After applying changes” section.

  • Enter the following in the rule's If condition expression field to trigger the scenario only when the GPTQuestion field is changed during the current update:

    ${current_update.GPTQuestion_c.IsChanged}

  • Select the OpenAI integration and scenario to be triggered.
